All, 

as I've mentioned in the comments, if you use VLC there is absolutely NO problem switching between the audio tracks. Using mplayer, it plays the first audio track as well and there's a command line option to turn it off. As XBMC uses mplayer, it too plays the videos just fine and even detects the second audio stream. 

As far as disabling one of the tracks to burn to a DVD goes, my suggestion is to do this: open it in VirtualDubMod, go under "Streams -> Stream List," then disable the ones you don't want to hear in your new file, "Video -> Direct Stream Copy," and then save as a new file. 

Glad to see that so many people are still enjoying the torrent!

"Stoke me a clipper - I'll be back for Christmas"

And if you are on a Linux distro, then I recommend using the cross platform program AVIDemux.

and correction from above: "mplayer " will play the video with the 1st audio track active. The option to change the audio track from the command line is "-aid n" where n is the track number, starting with 1 and increasing.
